title.narrative: Appui d'urgence en Eau, Hygiène et Assainissement aux ménages de retournés dans Koui, Bocaranga, Bozoum

description.narrative: 13719 men, women, boys and girls of Bocaranga-Koui Bozoum axis, affected by violence related to armed conflict

The situation in the Ouham Pendé prefecture has been characterized by chronic conflicts among rival armed groups causing massive movement of populations but also chronic vulnerability as returnees fear resurgence of violence and consequently rebuild their livelihood. Boreholes have been used during conflicts as mass graves and the protracted absence of the government and the governmental agencies leave a serious gap in the services in the zones particularly in the WASH sector. The Cordaid monitoring report indicate that more than 80% in the Bocaranga-Koui-Bozoum axis don’t have access to safety drinking water and hygienic toilette; therefore, practice open defecation, which is a source of water contamination in the bush. The few existing water points (rehabilitated a few years ago), are out of use. To date, there is no humanitarian actor who is positioned in this area in the WASH sector
Given the humanitarian situation and recommendations from the Wash Cluster and OCHA (Bocaranga Office, Cordaid propose The response through this allocation to target mainly the 13719 most affected populations in 13 villages in this axis (Bocaranga-Koui-Bozoum), including displaced people, host community and support for the returned populations in order to reduce their vulnerability through
